noun.description: The emergence of a baby or other young from the body of its mother; the start of life as a physically separate being.
examples: despite a difficult birth he's fit and healthy

verb.description: Give birth to (a baby or other young)
examples: she had carried him and birthed him

phrases: she gave birth to a son
she's due to give birth in March
The campaigning women said mothers need more than just a place to give birth, especially young mums.
Helen is the fifth generation of all women on her maternal line and my younger sister gave birth to a baby girl this year as well.
I have a very young family and am only a few days out of hospital after giving birth to my youngest son Michael.
origin: Middle English: from Old Norse byrth; related to bear.
